author: @httweets
title: Article 370 teaser: Yami Gautam vows to stop terrorism in Kashmir. Watch | Bollywood - Hindustan Times
text: Article 370 teaser: Yami Gautam vows to stop terrorism in Kashmir. Watch Yami Gautam plays an intelligence officer in Article 370, which is set in the valley and revolves around the removal of special status to Jammu & Kashmir. Actor [Yami Gautam](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/yami-gautam) will be next seen in political drama Article 370 which will be released in theatres on February 23, the makers have announced. The teaser was unveiled on Saturday, which showed Yami trying to make sense of the terrorism that dominates Jammu & Kashmir. (Also Read: [Yami Gautam soaks in winter sun, spends time with cows, picks oranges as she rings in New Year in Himachal Pradesh](https://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/yami-gautam-soaks-in-winter-sun-spends-time-with-cows-as-she-rings-in-new-year-himachal-pradesh-101704196200394.html)) What's in the teaser? In the teaser, Yami, in a fierce avatar, is seen saying that the terrorism in Kashmir isn't a product of people demanding azadi or freedom, but because it's a business created and sustained by corrupt politicians. She also claims that perpetrators can't be held until the special status given to Jammu & Kashmir is not withdrawn. [Click here](https://www.hindustantimes.com/ayodhya-ram-mandir-opening-ceremony?utm_source=web&utm_medium=middlearticle&utm_campaign=rammandir) At the end of the teaser, we see a Yami pointing a gun at someone, while sporting a bloodied face. As the screen goes blank, we see a voiceover announcing that Article 370 would be abrogated, thus removing the special status accorded to Jammu & Kashmir, turning the state into Union Territories. About the film Backed by Jio Studios & B62 Studios, the film will present a "powerful narrative inspired by true events that shaped the fate of Kashmir", a press release said. Article 370 is directed by Aditya Suhas Jambhale. Yami, known for films such as Badlapur, Uri: The Surgical Strike, Bala, A Thursday, and Chor Nikal Ke Bhaga, will essay the role of an intelligence agent in the movie, which revolves around the takedown of terrorism in Kashmir by rendering Article 370 ineffective. The Central government on August 5, 2019, had revoked Article 370, which gave special status to the erstwhile state of Jammu and Kashmir, and bifurcated it into union territories of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh. Article 370 is produced by Jyoti Deshpande, [Aditya Dhar](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/aditya-dhar) and Lokesh Dhar. Aditya, who is Yami's husband, directed her in the 2019 action blockbuster Uri: The Surgical Strike. They [ tied the knot](https://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/aditya-dhar-pens-adorable-birthday-wish-for-wife-yami-gautam-calls-her-most-beautiful-girl-101701165289600.html) in 2021. Entertainment! Entertainment! author: Pat Maio
title: Food workers union reaches tentative deal for 12,000 Stater Bros. workers
text:
The food workersâ€™ union representing more than 12,000 workers with Stater Bros. Markets reached a tentative agreement Wednesday, Aug. 6, on a new three-year labor contract at grocery stores throughout Southern California.
A spokeswoman with the United Food and Commercial Workers said that the new contract secures higher wages, pension contributions, healthcare improvements, staffing, and safety practices.
Further details of the tentative agreement will be shared with union members in upcoming meetings. No date was provided on when union members will vote on the tentative contract covering workers at 172 stores located from the U.S. Mexico border to Bakersfield.
â€œThis victory wouldnâ€™t have been possible without the power of our collective action,â€ the UFCW said in a statement Wednesday evening. â€œTogether, we stood up to the companyâ€™s disrespect and made it clear that we are a strong union family, united in solidarity to fight for the contract we deserve.â€
The tentative agreement comes almost a month after the regionâ€™s largest grocery workersâ€™ union agreed to a new a three-year contract with Boise, Idaho-based Albertsons Cos. and Cincinnati-based Kroger Cos. Two weeks later, the UFCW union voted to authorize an unfair labor practice strike against San Bernardino-based Stater Bros. â€” the first ever strike vote taken against the 89-year-old Stater Bros.
Also see: Union, supermarket chains reach tentative labor deal, averting strike
While the labor contracts involving 45,000 workers with Albertsons and Kroger were settled July 11, talks continued with the unionized Stater Bros., Encino-based Gelsonâ€™s Markets and Super A Foods, a family-owned supermarket chain based in Commerce that caters to Latino and Asian shoppers in the Los Angeles area.
The union also said Wednesday that workers with Super A Foods ratified their new contract last month. Gelsonâ€™s workers are currently negotiating to secure similar contract terms as those agreed to by 45,000 workers at Kroger and Albertsons, the UFCW said.
Staterâ€™s spokeswoman Nancy Negrette confirmed in a statement issued to the Southern California News Group that the San Bernardino-based supermarket chain reached the tentative agreement with the UFCW union.
â€œNegotiations were conducted in good faith, with both sides working hard to reach a fair deal that supports our teammates and holds the line on prices for our customers,â€ Negrette said. â€œWe appreciate the collaborative effort and are encouraged that the union is recommending the agreement for ratification.â€
Tough negotiations
In recent days, union officials had been saying privately that the talks were not going well.
On July 25, the UFCW said that its members voted to authorize their bargaining team to call for an Unfair Labor Practice strike, protesting alleged labor violations by Stater during the negotiations. An Unfair Labor Practice refers to actions taken by employers or unions that violate the rights of employees or union members, as defined by labor laws.
Earlier this year, after the contract with the UFCW expired on March 2, the relationship between the food workers and Staterâ€™s deteriorated quickly when the chain executives told 63 courtesy clerks they were laid off because of inflation and tariffs. In a video, the San Bernardino supermarket chainâ€™s chief executive blamed inflation and tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump for cutting the clerks at several Southern California stores.
Three days after the contract expired, more than 100 members of the UFCW picketed at the Stater Bros. store in Costa Mesa where courtesy clerks were laid off, urging the company to rehire them at other stores with job openings. Clerks also were laid off at three other stores, but the UFCW didnâ€™t picket them.
The clerks learned of their layoffs in a video shown to them Feb. 17, six days before their last day. The 10-minute video, viewed by the Southern California News Group, featured CEO Peter Van Helden, who discussed â€œreducing costsâ€ at the 172-store chain, ranging from cutting labor and electricity costs with solar-powered panels to â€œall kinds of things.â€
In the video, Van Helden blamed the layoffs on significant inflation, â€œmore than Iâ€™ve ever seen in my career,â€ with retail prices jumping 30% from levels seen four years ago. â€œIâ€™m pretty certain that in the future weâ€™re going to have to continue to reduce the number of jobs in this company. Itâ€™s a fact.â€
Jack Brown, who served as president and chief executive officer of Stater Bros. from 1981 until 2017, proudly boasted in an Orange County Register interview in 2016 that the company had never laid off an employee.
Even during the 2003-2004 grocery strike and lockout, Brown kept the stores open and accepted whatever agreement the union made with the other major supermarket chains in California. â€œIt was doing the right thing for right reasons. The right thing was to continue to serve our customers and to keep our people employed,â€ he said at the time.
The pace of the talks between the UFCW and chains was briefly disrupted in late March when the federal mediator assigned to their negotiations was fired by the Trump administration. The mediator, Isael Hermosillo, was later hired back independently by the two sides to help in the discussions.

author: @nzherald
title: â€˜Unattractiveâ€™ cars a turn-off for thieves, say police - NZ Herald
text:
By RNZ
Unattractive cars are at an advantage for once - police say that by being ugly, they are better protected from theft.
There has been a spike of cars being broken into and stolen in northern Auckland, and police are urging vehicle owners to take caution.
Senior Sergeant Roger Small said police are following a bump in reports of vehicle crime in KumeÅ« and Huapai.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. As well as vehicles being stolen, he said, there have been reported attempts to steal them, and valuables have been stolen from inside parked cars.
Small said police are asking drivers to take precautions to make their vehicle less of a target.
â€œWe want your vehicle to be as unattractive as possible,â€ Small said.
â€œThink about removing property from your car when you park up for the day: debit cards, the jacket on the back seat and even the two gold coins in the centre console.â€
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. Drivers should avoid leaving money or wallets in parked cars, and park inside a closed garage if possible, Small said.
â€œBy taking a few additional steps it could help in stopping your vehicle becoming an easy target and avoiding unnecessary frustrations at this time of the year.â€
- RNZ

Hay estudios que se han interesado mucho en este fenÃ³meno porque ya no solamente es el K-Pop, sino tambiÃ©n son las series, las pelÃ­culas y un montÃ³n de cosas que se han construido y que estÃ¡n implicadas en este fenÃ³meno â€, recalcÃ³.
Â¿El K-Pop no es fortuito? Julia Palacios asegurÃ³ que este fenÃ³meno no es fortuito, sino un plan milimÃ©tricamente trazado. â€œ El gobierno de Corea del Sur ha invertido con estas empresas de entretenimiento para dar una presencia de Corea del Sur en el mundo, una presencia amable, una imagen de Corea del Sur positivaâ€¦ â€.

â€œ Es un paÃ­s muy pequeÃ±o y, ademÃ¡s en una situaciÃ³n geogrÃ¡fica complicada, tiene a Corea del Norte, tiene a JapÃ³n, pero es esto lo que se llama el poder suave, la diplomacia cultura, como un mismo gobierno de un paÃ­s utiliza el entretenimiento para su presencia en el mundo â€, finalizÃ³.

title: MarÃ­a Corina Machado agradeciÃ³ respaldo de Alberto FeijÃ³o que exigiÃ³ elecciones libres en Venezuela - LaPatilla.com
text: La candidata presidencial de la Plataforma Unitaria, MarÃ­a Corina Machado, expresÃ³ este jueves su agradecimiento al lÃ­der del Partido Popular (PP) de EspaÃ±a, Alberto NÃºÃ±ez FeijÃ³o, por ratificar su apoyo y exigir elecciones libres en Venezuela. Por lapatilla.com

author: Nadja Hoffmann
title: FÃ¶rderung: Zukunft der Musikschule Ataraxia gesichert
text:
Bildung fÃ¼r Kinder und Jugendliche
Stadt erhÃ¶ht FÃ¶rderung: Zukunft der Musikschule Ataraxia gesichert
Schwerin / Lesedauer: 1 min
Die Zukunft der Schweriner Musik- und Kunstschule Ataraxia ist vorerst gesichert. Nach monatelanger Ungewissheit hat die Stadt ihre FÃ¶rderung um 100.000 Euro erhÃ¶ht. Am Dienstag Ã¼bergab Kultur- und Finanzdezernent Silvio Horn den entsprechenden Zuwendungsbescheid an GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrerin Daria Gorgel-Schmidt und Schulleiter Johann Ahl.
â€žDie Schule leistet in der Landeshauptstadt Schwerin einen unverzichtbaren Beitrag zur kulturellen Bildung unserer Kinder und Jugendlichenâ€œ, so Finanzdezernent Silvio Horn. â€žGemeinsam mit dem Land Mecklenburg-Vorpommern konnten wir sicherstellen, dass das generationenÃ¼bergreifende Angebot von Ataraxia auch weiterhin aufrechterhalten wird.â€œ
Stadt Schwerin stockt KulturfÃ¶rderung deutlich auf
Insgesamt unterstÃ¼tzt die Landeshauptstadt die Schule damit nun mit knapp 400.000 Euro jÃ¤hrlich. Grundlage fÃ¼r die Aufstockung war ein Haushaltskompromiss, den die Stadtvertretung kÃ¼rzlich beschlossen hatte.
Gemeinsam mit dem Land Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, das zusÃ¤tzlich 70.000 Euro bereitstellt, konnte die entstandene FinanzierungslÃ¼cke von insgesamt 170.000 Euro geschlossen werden. Diese war durch das sogenannte Herrenberg-Urteil entstanden, das die BeschÃ¤ftigung freier Mitarbeiter neu regelt und hÃ¶here Personalkosten verursacht.
Nachfrage nach kultureller Bildung bleibt hoch
Noch vor wenigen Wochen war unklar, ob das Angebot der Schule weiterbestehen kann. SchÃ¼ler, Eltern und LehrkrÃ¤fte gingen auf die StraÃŸe, um auf die drohenden Einschnitte aufmerksam zu machen. Inzwischen ist der Unterrichtsbetrieb wieder hergestellt, die Wartezeiten auf Kurse bleiben jedoch lang.
Mehr als 70 Mitarbeitende unterrichten wÃ¶chentlich Ã¼ber 600 Stunden in Musik, Kunst, Tanz und Schauspiel. Die Nachfrage Ã¼bersteigt die KapazitÃ¤ten deutlich. Ataraxia versteht sich als zentraler Akteur kultureller Bildung in Schwerin â€“ und das wurde in den vergangenen Wochen lautstark gezeigt und auf der StraÃŸe sichtbar gemacht.
